title: Darkness: The Vampire Version [1993 - USA] underground horror
description:
Darkness: The Vampire Version (1993 - USA)             aka Leif Jonker's Darkness

Horror

13th Dream Entertainment Production Company
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0106669/


Director Leif Jonker's raw, powerful vampire gorefest Darkness has sustained a decade-long cult buzz as one of the cornerstone films of the underground, microcinema scene. It delivers a string of harrowing, shocking scenes, presented with such unvarnished acting and production value that the film almost seems lensed in a quasi- (or perhaps we should say queasy-) documentary style. From start to finish it is one of the goriest movies you'll ever see. Hardly a minute goes by without blood spurting across the screen, an eyeball popping or a head exploding. The climax alone gives the lawn mower scene in Peter Jackson's Dead Alive a very chunky run for its money. The film also has a great metal soundtrack.


Video: MPEG4 Video (H264), 720x400, 23.976 fps, 01h23m14s
Audio: AAC, 48000 Hz, stereo
